article.title: Achduart
article.paragraph:
Use British EnglishApril 2012Use dmy datesApril 2012Infobox UK place Scotland Achduart
Achadh Dhubhaird
[[File:Achduart with Cairn Conmheall behind.jpg|250px]] Achduart with Cairn Conmheall (541 m) behind NC050037 Ross and Cromarty 57.980272 -5.299201 [[Highland (council area)|Highland]]
IV26 2 IV
Achduart(Scottish Gaelic languageGaelic:Achadh Dhubhaird) is a small hamlet inCoigach, inWester Rossin northwesternScotland, now within theHighland (council area)Highlandcouncil area.cite map[[Google Maps]]Googlecite map[[Bing Maps]][[Microsoft]] and [[Harris Corporation]] Earthstar Geographics LLCIt is situated about 4 km southeast of the village ofAchiltibuie, at the end of a minor road. A footpath continues on to the hamlet of Culnacraig, then along the coast pastBen More CoigachtoStrathcanaird.cite webCulnacraig circularhttp://www.walkhighlands.co.uk/ullapool/culnacraig.shtmlWalk Highlands23 April 2011Achduart has accommodation facilities for tourists, who come for its proximity to the ocean as well as its seclusion and remoteness. There is aScottish Youth Hostels Associationhostel in Acheninver, a short distance to the north.

The name of Achduart comes from the Gaelic for "the field at the black headland".cite webIain Mac an TÃ illeir2003[[Scottish Parliament]]http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/vli/language/gaelic/vl-trans.htmPlacenames collected by Iain Mac an Tailleir29 January 2011http://web.archive.org/web/20101225005529/http://scottish.parliament.uk/vli/language/gaelic/vl-trans.htm25 December 2010noAchduart was part of the Estate of Coigach, Lochbroom, belonging to theEarl of CromartieCountess of Cromartie.cite bookhttp://books.google.co.uk/books?idPapers by command, Volume 15Great Britain. Parliament. House of Commons, HMSO191178
The dominant geographical feature in the area isCairn Conmheall, which rises to 541 metres.
